result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Bradley Michael Dohr
Current: W7084 County Rd W, Phillips, WI 54555 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: N5267 Lound Rd, Prentice, WI 54556

If not already completed Defendant must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): D.E.B.     DOB: 10/16/2005
*No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:26 AM Defendant Bradley Michael Dohr in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. DA Kelz gives bond recommendations. Notice of right to attorney given to Defendant Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
